of(java.lang.Class<T>,java.lang.Class<V>.Description: This factory method creates and returns a Property given the class and name parameters, where the "name" parameter represents either: a public getName() method on the class which takes no arguments, plus an optional public setName() method which takes a value of the same type returned by getName() a public isName() method on the class which takes no arguments, plus an optional public setName() method which takes a value of the same type returned by isName() a public name field on the class If either of the get/is method alternatives is found on the class, but an appropriate setName() method is not found, the Property will be @B_android#util#Property#isReadOnly_E@. Calling the @B_android#util#Property#set_E@ method on such a property is allowed, but will have no effect. If neither the methods nor the field are found on the class a @B_android#util#NoSuchPropertyException_E@ exception will be thrown.
of(java.lang.Class<T>,java.lang.Class<V>.FullName: public static Property<T, V> of (Class<T> hostType, Class<V> valueType, String name)

Property(java.lang.Class<V>,java.lang.St.Description: A constructor that takes an identifying name and @B_android#util#Property#getType_E@ for the property.

get(T).Description: Returns the current value that this property represents on the given object.

set(T, V).Description: Sets the value on object which this property represents. If the method is unable to set the value on the target object it will throw an @B_java#lang#UnsupportedOperationException_E@ exception.
set(T, V).FullName: public void set (T object, V value)

getType().Description: Returns the type for this property.

isReadOnly().Description: Returns true if the @B_android#util#Property#set_E@ method does not set the value on the target object (in which case the @B_android#util#Property#set_E@ method should throw a @B_android#util#NoSuchPropertyException_E@ exception). This may happen if the Property wraps functionality that allows querying the underlying value but not setting it. For example, the @B_android#util#Property#of_E@ factory method may return a Property with name "foo" for an object that has only a getFoo() or isFoo() method, but no matching setFoo() method.

set(T,V).Description: Sets the value on object which this property represents. If the method is unable to set the value on the target object it will throw an @B_java#lang#UnsupportedOperationException_E@ exception.
set(T,V).FullName: public void set (T object, V value)

getName().Description: Returns the name for this property.
